quality_assessment: Excellent troubleshooting guide with comprehensive coverage of common variable interpolation issues. Well-organized by issue type with clear symptoms, causes, and solutions. All examples are accurate and align with implementation.
positive_aspects: Comprehensive coverage of variable interpolation issues organized by symptom
Clear distinction between different issue types (not interpolating, empty/undefined, phase-specific, nested field access, git context, format modifiers)
Accurate examples showing both wrong and correct usage patterns
Well-structured troubleshooting workflow from symptoms to solutions
Excellent debugging techniques section with practical tools (verbose mode, echo debugging, Claude logs, checkpoint inspection, jq exploration)
Common syntax issues section addresses YAML-specific gotchas
Best practices section provides actionable guidance
All internal links are valid and properly reference sibling subsections
Phase availability guidance correctly references the available-variables subsection
Accurate representation of capture_output and capture_format functionality
Correct explanation of git context variables (step.*, workflow.*) and their requirements
Format modifier section accurately describes :json, :lines, :csv, and glob pattern filtering
Shell-specific syntax issues (quoting, escaping) are well-covered
Getting Help section provides clear escalation path
improvement_suggestions: Consider adding a quick reference table mapping error messages to solutions for faster lookup
Could include a flowchart for diagnosing variable issues systematically
Might benefit from a 'Most Common Issues' section at the top for quick wins
Consider adding links to specific source code files for advanced users wanting to understand implementation details

metadata.validation_focus: Check troubleshooting variable interpolation documentation matches implementation
